critique: This document is an executive order from 1940 that withdraws public land in Kotzebue, Alaska for use by the War Department as a radio station site. It is a very specific action related to national defense during a time of global conflict. There is little to suggest a strong ideological tilt. The order does not directly address immigration. It expands executive power by withdrawing land. It centralizes control with the federal government. It prioritizes national security. It has no direct economic regulation implications. It has no implications for social inclusion.
